decks.notes: This deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Nissa to draw cards and ramp up mana, while also using counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Uro to apply pressure and gain incremental advantages over time. The combination of card advantage, removal, and threats allows the deck to outvalue and outlast opponents in a grindy game.

This Mono Green Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Questing Beast, and Stonecoil Serpent. It also includes cards like Primal Might and Ranger's Guile for removal and protection. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures while using cards like Scavenging Ooze and Garruk's Harbinger to maintain card advantage and adapt to different situations. Castle Garenbrig and Mobilized District provide additional utility and flexibility in the deck's strategy.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using efficient creatures such as Pelt Collector, Scavenging Ooze, and Stonecoil Serpent. The deck also includes powerful support cards like Primal Might and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger to ensure board control. With a strong curve of threats from Lovestruck Beast to Questing Beast, backed up by Garruk's Harbinger and Gemrazer for additional value, this Mono Green Aggro deck seeks to apply constant pressure and end the game quickly.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to establish a powerful control over the game through various means such as countering spells with Negate and Tale's End, removing threats with Eat to Extinction and Agonizing Remorse, and generating card advantage with cards like Mazemind Tome and Shark Typhoon. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to play powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating value and ramping up towards powerful late-game threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively dominate the opponent by utilizing sacrifice strategies and stealing their creatures. The deck focuses on using cards like Claim the Firstborn and Whisper Squad to gain control of the opponent's creatures, then sacrificing them for value with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Woe Strider. Additionally, the deck has strong card draw options with Village Rites and Castle Locthwain. It also includes powerful creatures such as Rankle, Master of Pranks and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to deal damage and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by denying the opponent resources and card advantage while generating value through powerful threats like Uro and Hydroid Krasis. This is achieved through a combination of disruptive cards like Narset, Agonizing Remorse, and Aether Gust, along with efficient removal spells like Eliminate. The deck also aims to ramp into its top-end threats with Nissa, Who Shakes the World and utilize card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. Shark Typhoon serves as a versatile finisher that can create a board presence or generate additional cards.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and powerful planeswalker abilities. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and mana advantage through cards like Narset, Nissa, and Uro. Shark Typhoon provides a win condition that can be difficult for opponents to deal with, while cards like Agonizing Remorse and Aether Gust help to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win over the course of a long game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and value through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Shark Typhoon and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to close out the game once it has gained control. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color strategy and ensure consistent access to all its key cards.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly build a board presence by playing aggressive creatures and utilizing Adventure cards for added value. By utilizing cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lucky Clover, the deck can generate card advantage and create explosive turns. The inclusion of powerful spells such as Aether Gust and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provides additional utility and flexibility in handling various situations. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient game plan while maintaining card advantage and resource management.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a board presence by utilizing the Adventure mechanic to efficiently cast creatures and spells. By leveraging cards like Fae of Wishes and Lucky Clover, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and versatile interaction spells. With a strong mana base and a mix of creature types, the deck is able to consistently apply pressure and adapt to various matchups in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 format.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the board by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and creatures with disruptive abilities. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by recurring cards with Yorion, Sky Nomad and Eerie Ultimatum, while also gaining card advantage with cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Treacherous Blessing. The deck also has a strong midrange plan with creatures like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Basilica Bell-Haunt to pressure the opponent and disrupt their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize various counterspells and removal spells to control the opponent's plays while ramping up mana with cards like Uro and Cultivate. The deck aims to maintain board control and card advantage through powerful threats such as Hydroid Krasis and Shark Typhoon, while also utilizing planeswalkers like Nissa and Narset to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells across three different colors, making it a versatile and adaptable control deck in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board with powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Nissa, while generating card advantage with Narset and Uro. Shark Typhoon provides a win condition while also creating blockers. The mana base is built to support the three-color combination, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. By controlling the game and out-valuing opponents, this deck aims to grind out victories through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of the Sultai Control deck is to use a combination of counter spells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells and removing threats from the board while generating card advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Shark Typhoon to close out the game once it has established control.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Nissa. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and gaining incremental value through cards like Narset and Uro. The deck also has a strong late-game plan with cards like Casualties of War and Shark Typhoon to close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three color identity and ensure smooth mana development throughout the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, using Winota, Joiner of Forces to cheat out powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a rapid board presence. By including a mix of low-cost creatures like Fervent Champion and Lazotep Reaver, along with powerful support cards like Embercleave and Basri's Lieutenant, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board state and close out games before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is designed to support a mix of white, black, and red cards, ensuring smooth color access for all spells.
